abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Safety Net SAC Project for
            Bolivia had the following ratings: the outcome was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was high, and the Bank and
            borrower performance were both satisfactory. The lessons
            learned indicate that it is generally agreed that volatility
            (and periodic intra-year cuts) in funding for social
            protection programs should be avoided since it leads to
            inefficiency and ultimately substantial costs in terms of
            lost human capital development in the medium term. The use
            of well-defined indicators associated with the expected
            results helps not only the implementation of the credit, but
            the targeting of actions by the Government. The Social
            Safety Net Structural Adjusment Credit (SSNSAC) focused
            attention on a few well-selected programs that were closely
            aligned to the overall goal of the program-social protection
            in a time of fiscal constraints. A structural adjustment
            operation that involves a process of relatively complex
            change, such as the establishment of an effective social
            safety net, will be difficult to implement on an operational
            level. To improve the results of education and health
            services and of social protection programs and expand access
            to the most vulnerable populations (often indigenous
            peoples), awareness and training activities should be
            expanded through dialogue and focus groups mechanisms
            promoting the reduction of cultural impediments to accessing
            services. Technical assistance should be provided for the
            development of information systems, within the Information
            and Administrative Modernization System (SIGMA), so that
            better decisions can be adopted on the use of public
            resources and their follow-up at all levels of Government.
